channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Poll: Youth likelier to meet more groups for socialising
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

When it comes to Covid-19, Mr Lim Chia Wei plays by the rules. He wears a mask, maintains safe distancing, washes his hands regularly and uses common serving utensils when sharing food.

item.title: Key to get bosses, workers working together amid virus crisis: NWC chief
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

It may seem that employers and workers would have competing concerns amid the Covid-19 crisis, but the challenges are showing that the way ahead lies in cooperation, said National Wages Council (NWC) chairman Peter Seah.

item.title: Over 20 souvenir shops shut, more to follow
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 20 tourist souvenir shops in Singapore, several of which have been in operation for decades, have closed for good - casualties of Covid-19 travel restrictions here and around the world.

item.title: 44% of people here tired of rules to limit virus spread: Survey
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

With seven in 10 Singaporeans saying the Covid-19 outbreak has lasted longer than they anticipated, people are becoming weary of the rules to limit the spread of the virus, according to a Sunday Times survey of 1,000 people.

item.title: MRT supplier Alstom gets green light to acquire competitor
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The competition watchdog has given the green light to French train-maker Alstom's US$7 billion (S$9.6 billion) buyout of Bombardier Transportation.

item.title: MOH to contact visitors to KTV premises in Khatib
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Health (MOH) will be contacting and facilitating tests for all visitors who went to Jewel Music Box KTV at HomeTeamNS Khatib on Aug 1 and 2 as a precaution, after investigations found that three coronavirus cases visited the place at the time.

item.title: He came from India with just $50 and pocket full of ambition
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

In Singapore's start-up circles, Mr Anurag Srivastava is sometimes referred to as Shah Rukh Khan.

item.title: Hostels cry for help
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Staycations are keeping the cash registers ringing at local hotels amid the pandemic, but backpacker hostels are out in the cold.

item.title: Engineering company looks to new industries
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Most of the business done by precision engineering company Coway Engineering & Marketing was in the aerospace and oil and gas industries - sectors hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic and global economic slowdown.

item.title: Remembering the fight in S-E Asia
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Japan. Noon, 75 years ago. Emperor Hirohito, in a historic speech broadcast on radio, told his people to stop fighting, ending nearly six years of global war.

item.title: Ex-nurse has finger on pulse of F&B challenges
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Since joining the food and beverage industry 14 months ago after she left the nursing profession, Ms Norefa Riffin has gone from having zero experience in the field to overseeing inventory, finances and menu planning, even manning the stove herself.

item.title: Singapore in a jam over dirty loos
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Actress and comedian Siti Khalijah Zainal is at her energetic best, clad in an eye-popping multi-coloured outfit and combining rapping, singing and dancing with deceptive ease.

item.title: Doctors can now move across hospitals after easing of curbs
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Measures requiring doctors in the public and private sectors to limit their movements across healthcare institutions as a precautionary move against Covid-19 have been lifted, said the Ministry of Health (MOH).

item.title: 155 Muis beneficiary homes in Sengkang get korban meat
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Over 150 homes in Sengkang received korban meat yesterday from sheep sacrificed during Hari Raya Haji.

item.title: Temasek calls out racist Facebook posts
item.description:
August 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Temasek described as "racist", "false" and "divisive" Facebook posts targeting its Indian employees, standing by its hiring policies while calling for more civility on social media.

item.title: Domestic tourism to Singapore's east coast to be promoted: DPM Heng
item.description:
August 16, 2020 12:58 AM

SINGAPORE - Drawing local visitors to the "many hidden gems" on Singapore's east coast is something that grassroots organisations in East Coast GRC are looking to do, by working with government agencies to showcase them, said Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat on Saturday (Aug 15).

item.title: Jewel Music Box KTV at HomeTeamNS Khatib among places visited by Covid-19 cases
item.description:
August 16, 2020 12:48 AM

MOH said it will be contacting all visitors who were at the new KTV premises on Aug 1 and 2 and facilitate tests for them as a precaution.
